name: The Referral Partnership Weekly Meeting
how_to_find_us: Enter on the alley. Please park on the street; all lot parking is reserved.

name: HM Cowork & Collaborate Day
description:
Sunnyside Station is offering a free coworking day exclusively to Highlands Mommies and Dads.

Bring your laptop and some work, and Sunnyside Station will provide wifi, a workspace, bottomless coffee and tea, free breakfast burritos, snacks, and a collaborative environment to share ideas.

name: Meet and Greet
description: Come, have a bite to eat, meet new people and talk about everything that makes you happy!

name: Pence & O' Fallon Parks
description:
I keep trying to get to this hike and never seem to make it so trying again.... Let's hike the trails in Pence and O'Fallon Parks. Basically we will hike the southwestern trails of O'Fallon Park and all the trails in Pence Park, this will be 7.5-9 moderate miles depending on conditions and what people are up for. We will start at the parking lot off 74 just east of Kittredge.

https://www.denvergov.org/content/dam/denvergov/Portals/747/documents/ParkArt/corwina_ofallon_pence.pdf


I have not hiked this part of the park before so most of this will be new to me, feedback is appreciated. 


For carpooling we will meet in the parking lot on the south east corner of Iris and 28th, behind 3 Margaritas. If you are meeting us at the trailhead please indicate that below.

Plan on an average hiking pace of over two miles an hour. Bring energy foods, plenty of water, lunch, snow gear, warm gear (it could be chilly and wind is always possible), sun gear (sunscreen, hat, sunglasses), traction devices, perhaps hiking poles, dress in layers, bring a gps and/or compass if you have them. Be prepared for changes in weather and variable conditions. Be self-sufficient, you are hiking at your own risk. Please read the full hike description before signing up for this hike.

name: STSP: Wednesday Morning Walk 'n Talk
description:
TYPE: STSP Weekly | PACE: Conversational | TERRAIN: Mostly sidewalk, some grass/dirt trail, some road | DIFFICULTY: Sloping hills | DISTANCE: Approx. 3 mi | COST: Free

Greetings!

We are delighted to host a weekly opportunity for walking through Golden and talking with each other about everything under the (Golden) sun! Come alone or with friends, or to make new friends! Please feel free to “drop-in” anytime.

We will cover a gentle route at a conversational pace with an emphasis on easy movement and pleasant company.

We will meet at 10:00am inside the cafe, make introductions, answer questions and lightly warm up. 

If you are going to get a hot beverage, borrow traction devices, or use the restroom, please plan to show up well before 10:00am as we will leave NO LATER than 10:05am.  We should be done walking no later than 11:15am.  You can of course leave early if you need to!

Please be sure to RSVP so we can notify you in the unlikely event the walk is cancelled. Thank you!

Feel free to contact walking trip host Betty at [masked] or [masked] if you have questions!

First Timers/Waivers: If this is your first time walking with Betty or if you have not completed a Welcome Waiver in 2016, please arrive 5-10 minutes early to connect, learn more about the walk, and complete a waiver. 

Parking: There will be plenty of parking in the parking lot across the street from the cafe.

Weather: We are in the Winter season, so please come prepared with enough layers and/or waterproof gear to keep yourself comfortable. As the conditions underfoot are not completely predictable, it would be good to bring along any traction devices (e.g., Yaktrax, Microspikes, Krokers) if you have them. Golden Walks has a few to lend. Hand warmers will be provided if desired.

Restroom: Restroom is available at the cafe.

Dog Friendly! Please consider whether your dog is calm & well-behaved in a group. S/he MUST stay on a maximum 6' leash; please be sure to bring baggies.

Note: Golden Walks [Walk2Connect partner] are very informal and give us all unique opportunities to connect with one another, with ourselves and with our surroundings.

Let's walk!

Betty

name: Coffee; too early for wine.
description:
Ask hostess for Nancy. Also, I look like my profile pic, too. Go figure!
Am new to the Meetup app, so forgive me for 10-1:00 times. I did not understand the end time "button". Hope no one shows up at 12:30!

name: Let's get out and get moving!
description:
Walking is the super food of movement, but like any super food the way you consume it matters.  On our walk we will discuss some of the junk foods of walking and we will play around with how we walk.

Meet at the Dawson park playground in Longmont, Colorado for a walk around McIntosh lake 3 1/2 miles. As we walk we will discuss, gait and different ways of walking/running. What's natural, what's not. It's fun and beautiful and a great way to get to know each other.

name: Business Lunch
description: We meet Weekly, Please come prepared with plenty of business cards to pass, two 33 second commercial/ elevator moments. we have chosen to support le peep for allowing us to use the space, the 13.00 per week fee covers the room, any lunch item off the menu, tax and gratuity. They have great food and drink options and many gluten free accommodations if that is better for you.

name: Regular lunch meeting of the Business Women's Connection
description:
We are the BWC! We meet every Wednesday from 11:15am to 12:45pm.  

We encourage you to RSVP (either by clicking "join" on the meetup site, or calling[masked] for Karelle or[masked] for Ruth). This group offers exclusivity (one member per business category), so if you call, we can let you know if there’s already a member representing your business area.   

You may visit twice before deciding whether you would like to join the group.  Please also feel free to visit our website (http://businesswomensconnection.com/) for more information.  

We're always excited to meet guests and new potential members!

name: NEW DATE BETTER WEATHER WED🚲🚲 Interm 🚲18Mile­️ Chatfield Reservoir, 13-15 mph

group.name: Women's  Bear Creek Biking - Get back in Shape - Week Days

description:
NEW DATE - BETTER WEATHER - WE HAVE CHANGED THE MEETUP TO WED INSTEAD OF TUESDAY!!  


Hi Ladies, 


     This will be an 18 mile total  bike ride on an out and back ride to Chatfield Reservoir on WED. FEB 23.    The group will meet at 11:30 am and  will be leaving by 11:45 or earlier. This is an intermediate ride as the group  will be going between 13-15 mile an hour.  I would like for the group  to stay together so that the ride will go smoothly.   Keep a look out for the person behind you and let the leader or the person in front of you  know if  someone has fallen back.  The ride will start from the parking lot of "Bout Time Pub and Grub".  The group will head a very short distance east till we get to the bridge and then we  will be heading south  on the Platte River till the Reservoir.  There is a little hill right before you get there, but I think everyone will do fine.  Our resting and turn around point will be at the bench.  

     The "Bout Time Pub"  is across the street from the Regal Theater at River Point. 

Hope to see you then!

 Vicky E.

name: The Denver Search Engine Optimization Meetup Group Monthly Meetup

group.name: The Denver Search Engine Optimization Meetup Group

description:
Join us for a discussion on jobs in SEO and Digital Marketing! 

Jill Bartholomew, Nellie Hayes, and Ann Kopetsky from The Creative Group will be leading a discussion on trends, including what employers are looking for in the digital market right now. They will also discuss building up your resume to stand out in a competitive market - whether you’re working as a freelancer, at an agency, or in-house. Additionally, they will share tips and best practices for working with TCG or other staffing agencies. 

Come network with local SEOs, webmasters, and agency folks. The Denver SEO Meetup is a place to learn, drink beer, network, and share your link building and SEO genius with other SEO professionals.
